definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
"roof" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 40), occurring in 家, 定, 安 etc/see also 寶蓋|宝盖[bao3 gai4]
to comply with/to abide by/to respect (an agreement)
to wait for/to expect/to keep watch/to watch over/to nurse
to hold fast to/to stick to
to stay behind to take care of things

sentences.english: Never far from her work, the mistress of the web patiently waits.
sentences.chinese: 蛛网的女主人永远守在自己的作品边，耐心的等候。

sentences.english: We often do not observe their own Fono.
sentences.chinese: 我们常常不守自己的福诺。

sentences.english: Therefore the LORD your God has commanded you to observe the Sabbath day.
sentences.chinese: 因此，耶和华你的神吩咐你守安息日。

sentences.english: Orton defends the World Title on both shows.
sentences.chinese: 奥顿守世界冠军都显示。

sentences.english: I always stick to be virginity to present the man who I will live together throughout my life.
sentences.chinese: 总是守着着份贞操留给和自己一辈子的男人。

sentences.english: How do we receive and keep the peace in Christ?
sentences.chinese: 如何领受并持守在基督里的平安？

sentences.english: You are disobeying the regulations, my friend.
sentences.chinese: 你们不守规则，我的朋友。

sentences.english: Yech…it's a nice day out. And here I am stuck inside the office with all this paper work.
sentences.chinese: 哎，外面天气多好，我却得守在办公室处理这些文件。

sentences.english: Then they could stay at home and look after the children — and the animals.
sentences.chinese: 于是，女人便能守在家中，照顾孩子，还能照管动物。

sentences.english: Then one day, the boy waited at the window, waiting for the flowers that person.
sentences.chinese: 于是有一天，男孩就守在窗边，等着那个送花的人。

sentences.english: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this passover kept.
sentences.chinese: 这逾越节是约西亚作王十八年守的。

sentences.english: Sea LanZhu coma lying in bed, defends huang taiji in the bedside old a lot.
sentences.chinese: 海兰珠一直昏迷躺在床上，皇太极守在床边苍老不少。

sentences.english: Time flies, you'll always have me.
sentences.chinese: 物换星移，我会永远守着你。

sentences.english: Ere such a soul regains its peaceful state.
sentences.chinese: 昨前如此灵魂重回清静守一之境。

sentences.english: The same applies to upholding the sutras.
sentences.chinese: 这同样适用于持守佛经。

sentences.english: These five precepts are the most important rules in our lives. Therefore, everyone should uphold the five precepts.
sentences.chinese: 这五戒是人生最要紧的规律，人人都应该守五戒。

definition: to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
to wait for/to expect/to keep watch/to watch over/to nurse
to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
(of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
to stay behind to take care of things
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
